Name: indexrelid
Description: the oid of the pg_class entry for this index

Name: indrelid
Description: the oid of the pg_class entry for the table this index is for

Name: indproc
Description: the function's oid if this is a functional index, else zero

Name: indkey
Description: this is a vector (array) of up to index_max_keys values that indicate which table columns this index pertains to. for example a value of 1 3 would mean that the first and the third column make up the index key. for a functional index, these columns are the inputs to the function, and the function's return value is the index key.

Name: indclass
Description: for each column in the index key this contains a reference to the "operator class" to use. see pg_opclass for details.

Name: indisclustered
Description: if true, the table was last clustered on this index.

Name: indisunique
Description: if true, this is a unique index.

Name: indisprimary
Description: if true, this index represents the primary key of the table. (indisunique should always be true when this is true.)

Name: indpred
Description: expression tree (in the form of a nodetostring representation) for partial index predicate. empty string if not a partial index.
